titleStmt.title: The Kings Majesties most gracious message sent to His Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax; wherein he declares his gracious will and pleasure, concerning his coming to London; as also some remarkable passages touching the generall and his armie.
titleStmt.author: Wilson, John, fl. 1647.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

notesStmt.note: Consists of two letters. The first, unsigned, contains a 3rd-person account of the King's message; the second is dated and signed at end: Windsor 6. of August, 1647. John Wilson.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
